intro: Eriastrum luteum, commonly known as yellow eriastrum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Eriastrum luteum is an important component of local flora, contributing to biodiversity in its native habitats.
